messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Digest Number 4274
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 12/14/03 3:07:36 PM Central Standard Time, ... Pam, I think I love you. Laura B. [Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 12/14/03 3:07:36 PM Central Standard Time,
UnschoolingDiscussion@yahoogroups.com writes:


> If you (anybody reading this) are
> one of those, you should know that it isn't your fault and it isn't
> because you don't have the "math gene" and it isn't because you were a
> girl and it isn't because you're "creative" and it isn't because you're
> just not a math brain. It is because the teaching methods used in
> schools are really really confusing and counterproductive to learning.
>
> Do no harm. That's a good policy when it comes to math.

Pam, I think I love you.

Laura B.
